titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to limit the number of consecutive terms that a Member of Congress may serve.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.

committee.name: House Judiciary
committee.subcommittee: Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties

bill.summary:
1/8/2009--Introduced.
Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits a person from serving more than two full consecutive terms as a Senator or six full consecutive terms as a Representative.
